the part of the head (= top part) of a hammer that is opposite the flat end and can be of various shapes: The ball peen hammer is used in metalworking. a cross peen hammer
More examplesFewer examplesThe other hammer has a peen tip with a cylindrical die.The hammerhead consists of a slightly bevelled flat head as well and a rounded cross peen.It's like attacking a battleship with a ball peen hammer.

to hit metal with a hammer to make it flatter: I found that the axle ends were peened, so the wheels couldn't easily be removed.
More examplesFewer examplesA type of power hammer peens the sheet metal.Mild steel can be peened by hand without using heat. You can practise on scrap pieces of metal before trying to peen your scythe blade.
